title: Tring Anglers swims
name: Tring Anglers swims
description:
A Map by Tringangler

My hotspots and favorite places on Tring Anglers waters

properties.name: 1st pound, GUC Aylesbury Arm
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerA good mix of species, including roach, gudgeon, perch (to over 2lb), bream and carp (with a few near to double figures).

properties.name: 2nd pound up, reservoir pounds, Marsworth, Grand Union canal
properties.description: Posted by Tringangler

properties.name: 2nd pound, GUC Aylesbury Arm
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerOne of my favorite spots. Very quiet and a regular hunting area for the local Kingfishers. Great mix of species with Roach, Gudgeon, Bream, Perch, Chub (to 3lb plus) and Carp. Can get a bit frustrated by the Crayfish!

properties.name: BlueBell Cafe pound, Marsworth, Grand Union canal
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerÂ With plenty of parking in the reservoir car park this is an easy spot to get to but it can be a bit busy. A full mix of species with perch, roach, bream and carp all in good quantity and to good size. This is quite a long pound and even holds a number of reasonable pike as well as the odd trout!!

properties.name: Bulbourne
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerGood all round fishing, with Roach, Perch, Bream and some Chub. In the summer, this is very good for some large Carp

properties.name: Church Lane, Marsworth, Grand Union Canal
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerOne of the most popular swims on this stretch but with strictly limited access and parking. A good mix of species, with perch, roach and bream as well as some large carp.

properties.name: Cooks Wharf
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerMembers Only

properties.name: Dixons Gap, GUC Aylesbury Arm. (Wingrave Road bridge)
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerThe pound below the bridge has good overhanging cover on the far bank and holds some very good fish! Perch, roach, bream, chub, carp (some very large) and tench.

properties.name: Ford End Farm, Ivinghoe
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerThe water contains perch, roach, bream, tench and carp. It starts as a narrow channel on the right of the track straight after the farm buildings, bending further to the right and widening into a long oval pool.

properties.name: Gudgeon stream, Wilstone, GUC Aylesbury Arm
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerJust below the lock where a small stream comes into the canal. A great place for gudgeon (well what do you expect?), roach and perch. Also bream, the occasional chub, an odd pike and some nice carp. Park in Wilstone village hall car park, cross the playing field then follow the canal to the left, past the lock and under the bridge.

properties.name: Red Lion bridge, Marsworth, Grand Union Canal
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerGood spinning for perch, to 2lb plus, on both sides of the bridge. The bay below the bridge is often particularly good.

properties.name: Wendover Arm - Bulbourne
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerThe Wendover Arm is often more like a small river than a Canal. A gentle flow and a good mix of species - Roach, Bream, Perch, Carp, Tench and Pike. A great summer Chub spot.

properties.name: Wendover Arm - Mill Bridge
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerGood sport for Roach, Bream, Perch and Gudgeon by the treatment outflow.

properties.name: White Lion, Marsworth, Grand Union canal
properties.description: Posted by TringanglerNO FISHING OUTSIDE THE PUB on either bank ! You may not be able to fish this spot, but bring some bread and feed the fish!!
